AvProblem.comment: foehn-driven snowfall easily triggered, near to and distant from ridgelines
on steep grass-covered slopes, possible at any time of day or night

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger above 1800 m is CONSIDERABLE, below that altitude danger is MODERATE. Main problem: freshly generated snowdrift accumulations. Slabs can trigger by minimum additional loading and grow to large size. If visibility permits, drifts are easily recognized. Winter sports in outlying terrain require much experience and self-restraint in route selection. Heed imperative to danger signs, e.g. whumpf noises, shooting cracks, snow plumes. In steep terrain, naturally triggered loose-snow avalanches are possible, also slablike releases. Glide-snow activity are still a threat. Snow can glide naturally over steep smooth ground, mostly small releases but can grow to large size. Avoid zones below glide-cracks.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The fresh snow from Friday (40-80 cm) has already settled somewhat. Southerly foehn winds have transported the loose snow, generated snowdrift accumulations or a slab. The fresh snow beneath this serves as a weak layer. Weak layers in the old snow are possible on north-facing slopes above 2400 m (also on south-facing high-alpine slopes), unlikely to trigger.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: Along the Hohe Tauern and Nockberge, heavy clouds are still moving in, reducing visibility, bringing occasional snowfall (max 10 cm). Winds are moderate to brisk from the south (70 km/hr in the foehn lanes). At 2000 m: -6 to -2 degrees; at 3000 m: -10 degrees.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The longer the foehn persists, the more fresh drifts accumulate. Thus, danger remains considerable.

AvProblem.comment: esp. near ridges, generated by southerly winds
on steep grass-covered slopes, possible anytime

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Pay close heed to signs of wind
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger above 2000 m is CONSIDERABLE, below that altitude danger is MODERATE. The freshly generated snowdrift accumulations from Friday can trigger a medium-sized slab avalanche by minimum additional loading, esp. near ridges. Drifts and danger signs (e.g. snow plumes) are mostly easy to recognize. In steep rocky terrain, small loose-snow avalanches are possible. Glide-snow avalanches on steep grass-covered slopes are still a threat, mostly small releases but can glide over the warm ground at any time.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The fresh snow from Friday (30-60 cm) has already settled somewhat. Southerly foehn winds have transported the loose snow, generated snowdrift accumulations or a slab. The fresh snow beneath this serves as a weak layer.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: On Sunday, clouds will often be heavier, but intermittent sunshine is likely despite reduced visibility on the higher summits. In afternoon, more sunshine. Southerly winds light to moderate, sufficient to transport the loose snow. At 2000 m: -6 to -2 degrees.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Avalanche danger levels are not expected to change significantly.

AvProblem.comment: on extremely steep slopes, also slab-like

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Avalanche danger above the treeline is MODERATE, below that altitude danger is low. The fresh snow from Friday has already settled somewhat, is well bonded with the snowpack. It can glide in its entirety over the warm ground.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The fresh snow from Friday has already settled somewhat, is generally well bonded. The snowpack can glide in its entirety over the warm ground.
BulletinMeasurements.wxSynopsisComment: On Sunday, clouds will often be heavier, but intermittent sunshine is likely despite reduced visibility on the higher summits. In afternoon, more sunshine. Southerly winds light to moderate, sufficient to transport the loose snow. At 2000 m: -6 to -2 degrees.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Avalanche danger levels are not expected to change significantly.
